H0.text: Evaporating is required to form shale, which is a common sedimentary rock.

H1.text: Condensing was required to form shale, a common sedimentary rock.

H2.text: Melting was the process required to form shale, a common sedimentary rock.

H3.text: Compacting is required to form shale, a common sedimentary rock.

A4.text: It is during compaction that shale develops its fissility, likely through mechanical compaction of the original open framework of clay particles.

A5.text: Fissility likely develops early in the compaction process, at relatively shallow depth, since fissility does not seem to vary with depth in thick formations.
